intro: Rubus norvicensis, commonly known as the common blackberry, is a shrub native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces aggregate fruits, known as berries, which are typically dark purple to black when ripe. These berries are rich in antioxidants and are widely used in culinary and medicinal applications. The plant thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in hedgerows and woodland edges.
